ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really loved how Professora Tordin really dedicated so much time to letting us speak and practice our speaking skills. I improved my essay-writing skills in Spanish. Little to no grammar is taught, as 140 assumes you know everything.

This course is really interesting because not only do you get to expand your Spanish knowledge and vocabulary, but you also get to discuss deeper topics within art such as ancestry, indigenous practices, classism, racism, etc.
Spanish speaking about complex topics
Enhanced my Spanish comprehension and speaking skills, especially pertaining to topics related to Latin and South American Spanish-speaking cultures.
My conversational Spanish improved greatly.
I gained a fonder appreciation of the Spanish culture and I developed my speaking skills especially.
Engaging in difficult political topics and deconstructing hegemonic gazes in Spanish.
Gained a ton of repetition when it came to understanding spanish

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths- great professor, very interactive, social, so much feedback 
Weaknesses- Jamboard gets kind of repetitive and some of the readings are confusing. I wish we learned more about day-to-day language, as I can communicate about gender and colonization, but not about basic cooking techniques or how to get around a Spanish-speaking country by myself.

Strengths-the professor and the curriculum 
Weaknesses- people being at very different ability levels
The curriculum is great for practicing and honing your already-developed Spanish-speaking skills. Could maybe use a little bit of a refresher on grammar at times.

I believe the main strength of this class was its active style of teaching, focusing more on learning to use the language to address relevant cultural topics through writing, class discussions and projects than on memorisation.
This class is beneficial as it forces you to engage with the language, which is essential.
The course improves your Spanish and your literacy in important topics. Daily classes make it extremely hard, especially when you have not done an assignment and need to catch up.
Objectives could be a bit better explained, but this course was taught in a far more organized fashion than my previous Spanish classes at Yale.

strengths: excellent teaching, fun and collaborative environment, great feedback from professor, fun assignments 

weaknesses: wish there were more straight vocabulary lists and grammar tests to improve understanding of fundamentals of spanish

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Professora Tordin is the best 140 teacher by-far! Everyone says so!
Definitely! A fantastic class
Yes
Yes!
I would recommend this class to anyone who wishes to improve their Spanish and use it in a real-world context.
YES YES YES! I loved SPAN 140 with my whole heart, especially with Tordin!
